Headline: Zero COVID-19 cases in 13 Zambo villages since last year – Manila Bulletin
Text: ZAMBOANGA CITY (PNA) – At least 13 of this city’s 98 barangays have no recorded cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) since last year, the City Health Office said Wednesday.Dr. Cathy Garcia, assistant city health officer, said most of the barangays with zero COVID-19 cases are coastal, upland, and island villages that are far from the city proper.“These barangays have not had a reported COVID-19 case to date,” Garcia said.This city has 4,267 confirmed COVID-19 cases with 4,020 recorded recoveries, 56 active cases, and 191 deaths as of March 22.Meanwhile, Garcia said that vaccination for barangay workers under the A1 priority is ongoing.Garcia said the A1 priority involves frontline workers in health facilities, both national and local, private and public, health professionals and non-professionals like students, nursing aides, janitors, and barangay health workers.She said this would be followed by the A2 priority covering senior citizens aged 60 years old and above.
